title: AI replaced Spain's human judgment in domestic violence cases—with tragic results | ABC NEWS
description: Predictive technology, including algorithms and AI, is replacing human roles in under-resourced public services like policing. In Spain, this technology assesses the safety needs of women fleeing domestic violence but has often failed, leading to tragic consequences. title: National Day of Reflection after Bondi terror attack | ABC NEWS
description: A National Day of Reflection is being held today to honour the victims of the terror attack at Bondi Beach.  People across the country are invited to light a candle at 6.47pm AEDT and observe a minute silence.   Tune into ABC NEWS special coverage on ABCTV and News Channel from 6pm AEDT as the nation honours the victims of the Bondi terror attacks.  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: PM announces review of intelligence and law enforcement in wake of Bondi attack | ABC NEWS
description: The Prime Minister, Anthony Albanese, has asked his department to lead a review into intelligence and law enforcement agencies following the Bondi terror attack. It will be led by Dennis Richardson, a former public servant who previously led spy agency ASIO and the Department of Defence. The review will examine whether agencies have the right "powers, structures, processes and sharing arrangements in place to keep Australians safe". title: Women's vigil honours Bondi Beach terror victims | ABC NEWS
description: Women gathered at Bondi Beach this morning to place flowers at the pavilion, an act organised by the National Council of Jewish Women Australia. Governor-General Sam Mostyn emphasised the need for "millions of mitzvahs, millions of acts of kindness" in her speech. title: Small businesses losing thousands of dollars to fraudulent chargebacks | ABC NEWS
description: Shoplifting has long been the bane of small businesses and now the theft has moved online, with frustrated owners telling business reporter Adelaide Miller they have lost thousands of dollars to fraudulent chargebacks — that is, online shoppers disputing legitimate transactions and receiving a refund.  The fake refund claims, instigated by shoppers requesting chargebacks through their banks, have been labelled theft. Online fashion store owner Sam Kemp posted a video to Instagram about her experience that went viral.  She says she's received hundreds of messages from other small business owners, who have had the same thing happen to them.  #ABCBusiness  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Images removed from Epstein files without explanation | ABC NEWS
description: Less than a day after they were released, the US Department of Justice has retracted at least 16 of the Epstein files with no explanation. It comes after the department failed to meet its legally mandated deadline to publish everything it has on the late sex offender. title: Australians unite to honour the lives lost one week on from the Bondi terror attack | ABC NEWS
description: Large crowds have gathered in Bondi, and people are coming together across the country, to pay tribute to the victims of Australia's worst terrorist attack. At 6:47, the time of the attack, there is a pause for a minute's silence. Candles will be lit to honour the 15 people killed by two gunmen at a Hannukah celebration. The day has been a National Day of Reflection with Australians from all backgrounds showing their support for the Jewish community. description: The Prime Minister has initiated a review of intelligence and law enforcement agencies following the recent Bondi terror attack. title: Women wear white to honour Bondi victims | ABC NEWS
description: Women from across Sydney have joined together at Bondi Pavilion at an event organised by the National Council of Jewish Women Australia and New South Wales.  Women from all backgrounds gathered at Bondi Beach wearing white, each with a single flower to honour the victims.   Governor-General Sam Mostyn joined those at the pavilion to pay respects and pledge a commitment to healing.   By Courtney Barrett Peters, ABC News Channel. Social version by David Douglas Stuart for the ABC News Social Media Team.  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Anti-immigration protests held in defiance of calls for unity | ABC NEWS
description: In Sydney and Melbourne, anti-immigration protests were held despite the objection of the prime minister, the states' premiers, and the Jewish community. The former deputy prime minister, Barnaby Joyce, spoke at the Sydney event in defiance of the calls for unity. title: PM booed, NSW premier Minns praised in Jewish leader's opening address | ABC NEWS
description: President of the NSW Jewish Board of Deputies, David Ossip, delivered the opening address to the ceremony. He thanked the crowd for attending and showing their solidarity with the Jewish community. Mr Ossip acknowledged the presence of Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, a remark that was met by loud boos from the crowd. The crowd cheered loudly at the mention of NSW Premier Chris Minns. description: President of the NSW Jewish Board of Deputies, David Ossip, has called out Ahmed Al Ahmed's heroism in tackling one of the Bondi gunmen last Sunday at tonight's vigil. title: Prince George joins Prince William in visit to homelessness charity | ABC NEWS
description: Prince William has spread some Christmas cheer with Prince George, taking the young royal into the kitchen of a homeless shelter to serve meals to those in need. In what's become a special family tradition, the future king re-created a special moment he once shared with his mother with his eldest son for a charity very close to his heart. title: Australians observe a minute's silence marking one week since the Bondi terror attack | ABC NEWS
description: Exactly one week on from the Bondi Beach massacre, the nation has paused to remember the victims of Australia's worst terrorist attack. Political and religious leaders were among thousands who gathered at the beach honouring the 15 lives lost, and the many others whose lives have been changed forever. title: WATCH NOW: Special coverage of the Bondi Beach National Day of Reflection | ABC NEWS
description: One week after the Bondi Beach massacre, the nation held a Day of Reflection service at the beach. Political and religious leaders joined thousands to honour the 15 lives lost and those affected by the tragedy. The service featured prayers, speeches, music, candle lighting, and the singing of "Waltzing Matilda."
